intro: Graffenrieda stellata, commonly known as the starflower or star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Graffenrieda stellata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
